Class Time

  • java.lang.Object
    • Time

  • public class Time
extends java.lang.Object
    Time Class used to define the starting time and duration of Subject. Seconds are not needed as subject classes typically start at an exact time and seconds are always considered zero.
    Author:
    Kamal Date 15/11/16.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      (package private) int HI_HOUR 
      (package private) int HI_MIN 
      private int hour
      Hours in 24 hours format 0-23
      private int min
      Minutes 0-59

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Time()
      Sets time to 0:00
      Time(int hour, int min)
      Sets the time to given int hour and int min if hours and min are out of range sets the time to 0:00

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static Time addTime(Time t1, Time t2)
      Takes two Time objects and add their hours and mins together.
      int getHour() 
      int getMin() 
      void setHour(int hour)
      Sets the Hours to a given int value between 0-23, if out of range sets hours to 0 Also prints a message "Error! Hours out Range"
      void setMin(int min)
      Set the minutes of Time to a given int value between 0-59, if out of range sets min to 0 Also prints a message "Error! Minutes out of Range"
      void setTime(int newHour, int newMin)
      Sets time accordingly if values of hour and min are more than maximum limits i.e.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Returns String in 12 hours format with AM and PM suffix
      java.lang.String toStringHrs()
      Returns a String with time in 24Hrs format.

      • Time

        public Time(int hour,

        min - int minutes -between 0-59 inclusive

    • Method Detail

      • addTime

        public static Time addTime(Time t1,
                           Time t2)
        Takes two Time objects and add their hours and mins together. If added minutes are more than 59, incremnts the hours and s
        Parameters:
        t1 - first Time object
        t2 - second Time object
        Returns:

      • setHour

        public void setHour(int hour)
        Sets the Hours to a given int value between 0-23, if out of range sets hours to 0 Also prints a message "Error! Hours out Range"
        Parameters:
        hour - int Hours section of Time.

      • setMin

        public void setMin(int min)
        Set the minutes of Time to a given int value between 0-59, if out of range sets min to 0 Also prints a message "Error! Minutes out of Range"
        Parameters:
        min - int minutes section of Time

      • setTime

        public void setTime(int newHour,
                    int newMin)
        Sets time accordingly if values of hour and min are more than maximum limits i.e. 23 and 59 respectively
        Parameters:
        newHour - int new Hour value can be any int value
        newMin - int new min value can be any in value

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns String in 12 hours format with AM and PM suffix
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        String time in 12 hours format eg. 12:23 PM, 4:13 AM,5:15 PM

      • toStringHrs

        public java.lang.String toStringHrs()
        Returns a String with time in 24Hrs format.
        Returns:
        String with time in 24Hrs format.
